main_definition: To change one's place or position, typically referring to relocating an object or person from one location to another.

meanings_and_examples.example: After selling their old home, the family is now moving into a new one in a different city.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Transferring from one school to another
meanings_and_examples.example: She was moving schools at the start of her senior year due to her parent's job transfer.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Change jobs and location for work purposes
meanings_and_examples.example: He is considering a move when he gets promoted because his new position requires him to relocate.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To progress or develop in time, especially emotionally
meanings_and_examples.example: After her father's death, she said that life felt like it was moving on without him.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Moving one's body while playing sports or dancing
meanings_and_examples.example: She demonstrated some new dance moves that involved a lot of moving around the stage.
